definition: current favorite/the latest thing/darling (of the market or the media etc)
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
new/newly/meso- (chemistry)
to love/to pamper/to spoil/to favor

sentences.english: Not to mention the perfect pal for your drinking needs is not far from a pork and kimchi stir-fry.
sentences.chinese: 当然用蛋包配上泡菜炒猪肉绝对是下酒菜的新宠儿。

sentences.english: Foreman is my new love and Foreman I shall love now.
sentences.chinese: 福满是我的新宠，从今开始我会喜欢福满。

sentences.english: Reykjavik is trendy with a lot of globetrotters nowadays.
sentences.chinese: 雷克雅未克现在是很多环游世界者的新宠。

sentences.english: In January you will become the zodiac's most favorite child!
sentences.chinese: 一月，你会成为黄道十二宫的新宠儿。

sentences.english: Laca elastic woven cloth has become a new favorite in dress trade.
sentences.chinese: 莱卡弹力机织布，已成为服饰行业中的一个新宠。

sentences.english: The new author has become a celebutante since the beginning of the year.
sentences.chinese: 新年伊始，那名新作家就成了名流新宠。

sentences.english: This pervert's delight has an MSRP of $99.
sentences.chinese: 这个变态的新宠儿的建议零售价是美金99元。

sentences.english: Now, we're the new darlings of the world.
sentences.chinese: 现在，我们成了这个世界的新宠。

sentences.english: In recent years the term virtualization has become the industry’s newest buzzword.
sentences.chinese: 最近几年，虚拟化渐渐成为了行业的新宠。

sentences.english: To match with my reds, I'd have gorgeous violet, today's outfit's mustard, new SS lover apple green.
sentences.chinese: 配红的还有贵气紫，今天的芥茉黄，春夏新宠苹果绿。

sentences.english: 'My new pet elephant, ' Bill replies solemly.
sentences.chinese: “我新宠的大象，”比尔郑重的回答道。

sentences.english: In design post-graduation education the PhD is fast becoming the new Masters.
sentences.chinese: 博士学位在设计领域的研究生教育中很快变为新宠。

definition: pet/favorite/darling
a craze/a popular wave/a hit with the public
delicious cakes/popular person/sth that is in high demand
a best-seller/a hot property
lit. burn your hand, feel the heat (idiom)/fig. arrogance of the powerful/a mighty figure no-one dares approach/hot (exciting or in favor)
nouveau riche/upstart/new appointee
first choice/premium/to come first in the imperial examinations
popular/hot/in vogue
to chase after (a popular person or item)/to pursue/popularity
(lit.) to fix one's gaze on/(fig.) to show interest in/(favorable) attention/favor
(a product) sells well/to be in demand
to emerge as a new force to be reckoned with (idiom)
great heat/very popular
to treasure/to be very fond of
to change shape in a single shake/fig. to take on a new lease of life
crispy fried chicken
